post.description:
Upload file to S3 bucket in tenant-specific folder

Args:
    file: File to upload
    bucket_name: Optional S3 bucket name (uses default if not provided)
    folder_name: Optional subfolder name (e.g., 'certificates', 'messages', 'documents')
    custom_filename: Optional custom filename
    tenant_name: Optional custom tenant name (uses current user's tenant if not provided)

Returns:
    dict: Upload result with S3 URL

Upload multiple files to S3 bucket in tenant-specific folder

Args:
    files: List of files to upload
    bucket_name: Optional S3 bucket name (uses default if not provided)
    folder_name: Optional subfolder name
    tenant_name: Optional custom tenant name (uses current user's tenant if not provided)

Returns:
    dict: Upload results with S3 URLs

get.description:
Check if S3 bucket exists and is accessible

Args:
    bucket_name: S3 bucket name to check

Returns:
    dict: Bucket accessibility status

schema.title: Response Check Bucket Access Api Files Buckets Check  Bucket Name  Get

post.description:
Generate presigned URL for accessing private S3 files

Args:
    s3_key: S3 object key (path to file in bucket)
    bucket_name: Optional S3 bucket name (uses default if not provided)
    expiration: URL expiration time in seconds (default: 3600 = 1 hour)

Returns:
    dict: Presigned URL and metadata

get.description:
Get AWS configuration information for debugging

Returns:
    dict: AWS configuration status (admin only)

schema.title: Response Get Aws Configuration Api Files Config Aws Get

get.description:
Debug AWS credentials (admin only)

Returns:
    dict: AWS credentials debug information

schema.title: Response Debug Aws Credentials Api Files Debug Credentials Get

post.description:
Test presigned URL generation with detailed debugging

Args:
    s3_key: S3 object key to test
    bucket_name: Optional bucket name

Returns:
    dict: Test results and debug information

schema.title: Response Test Presigned Url Generation Api Files Test Presigned Post

post.description:
Debug by uploading a file and immediately generating a presigned URL
This helps identify if there's a difference in credential handling

schema.title: Response Debug Upload Vs Presigned Api Files Debug Upload Vs Presigned Post

post.description: Simple presigned URL test using basic boto3 approach

schema.title: Response Simple Presigned Test Api Files Simple Presigned Test Post

post.description:
Upload file to OUTBOX S3 bucket in partner-specific pending folder

Args:
    file: File to upload
    partner_name: Name of the partner (will be used as folder name)

Returns:
    dict: Upload result with S3 URL
